page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Halstead}is a small market town with a population of 10,000 plus 800 in the village of Greenstead Green. Friday is the main market day, Wednesday is early closing. Lots of people used to work at Courtaulds Mill but it is now derelict and about to be restored as a restaurant. Factory Terrace is a row of old 3 storey cottages built in 1872. The mill workers used to live and work there. You can visit the police station and the cells, and the bandstand in the park. There is a lovely walk at Box Mill. The building behind the council offices, the brewery chapel, is being made into a museum. There is a cinema. If you want somewhere to stay try the Bull Hotel by the river or the White Hart on the hill. They are both very old.
